Business travellers use HMBS for booking special accommodation deals offered by participating hotels. Travellers register to HBMS by providing their name
column2: billing information (incl. company name and address) and optional travel preferences (e.g. breakfast included

column3: the date of arrival and departure
column4: the number of needed rooms and the type of rooms (e.g. single
column8: a tentative budget (max. cost per night)
column10: further travel preferences to filter offers in the search results. HBMS lists all available offers of hotels for the given travel period
column11: and the traveller can either create a preliminary booking or complete a booking in the regular way.

column1: In case of a preliminary booking
column2: HBMS forwards the key parameters of the booking information (i.e. price
column4: hotel rating and key preferences and a unique booking identifier) to other hotels so that they can compete for the traveller with special offers provided within the next 24 hours. After 24-hour deadline
column5: HBMS sends the five best special offers to the traveller who can switch to the new offer or proceed with the original preliminary booking.

column2: the traveller needs to provide credit card information to finalize a booking. Each finalized booking can be either pre-paid (i.e. paid immediately when it cannot be reimbursed)
column3: or paid at hotel (when the traveller pays during his/her stay). A finalized booking needs to be confirmed by the hotel within 24 hours. A booking may also contain a cancellation deadline: if the traveller cancels a confirmed booking before this deadline
column4: then there are no further consequences. However
column5: if a confirmed booking is cancelled after this deadline
column6: then 1-night accommodation is charged for the traveller. HBMS stores all past booking information for a traveller to calculate a reliability rating.

column1: Each hotel is located in a city at a particular address
column2: and possibly run by a hotel chain. A hotel may announce its available types of rooms for a given period in HBMS
column3: and may also inform HBMS when a particular type of room is fully booked. HBMS sends information about the preliminary booking information to competitor hotels together with the traveller?? preferences and his/her reliability rating. The competitor hotels may then provide a special offer. Once a booking is finalized
column4: the hotel needs to send a confirmation to the traveller. If a completed booking is not confirmed by the hotel within 24 hours
column5: then HBMS needs to cancel it
column6: and reimburse the traveller in case of a pre-paid booking. If the hotel needs to cancel a confirmed booking
column7: then financial compensation must be offered to the traveller.
